FuncDef:
The hard-pipe enable command enables a static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP to function as a public network CR-LSP for an IP hard pipe.
The undo hard-pipe command disables a static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP from functioning as a public network CR-LSP for an IP hard pipe.
By default, a static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP does not function as a public network CR-LSP for an IP hard pipe.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An IP hard pipe is a pipe technique that establishes a static PW over a static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP to simulate an SDH leased line. To enable a device to use a static PW over a static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP as a public network CR-LSP for an IP hard pipe, run the hard-pipe enable command.
Prerequisites
A static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP has been created using the bidirectional static-cr-lsp command.
Precautions
Note the following issues:
Do not specify the bandwidth for the static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP.The outgoing-interface interface-type interface-number parameter must be configured to specify an outbound interface of the static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP.
